intro: Cyrtandra cumingii var. yaeyamana, commonly known as Yaeyama Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
